Article Title: Dharmendra Pradhan, Haryana BJP win mastermind, to lead Bihar campaign
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Union minister Dharmendra Pradhan , a seasoned BJP campaigner and prominent OBC neta with extensive organisational experience, will be in charge of the party's campaign for the Bihar elections likely in November. He will be assisted by Union water resources minister and Gujarat BJP chief C R Patil and UP deputy chief minister Keshav Prasad Maurya.The party also announced key appointments for other critical state elections. Union minister Bhupender Yadav will serve as election in-charge for West Bengal, with former Tripura CM Biplab Kumar Deb as co-in-charge.In TN, party vice-president Baijayant 'Jay' Panda will oversee the campaign, with Union minister Murlidhar Mohol as co-in-charge.Pradhan and Yadav, both experienced strategists from the OBC community, have led BJP's election efforts across multiple states. Pradhan managed the Haryana elections and plotted a surprise win. Yadav oversaw the Maharashtra polls in 2024. Maurya and Deb, a Bengali, bring caste and regional advantages to their respective roles.The Union minister's social background may turn out to be useful in Bihar, which is dominated by OBCs and EBCs. tnn
Article Summary: Dharmendra Pradhan will be in charge of the party's campaign for the Bihar elections likely in November. He will be assisted by Gujarat BJP chief C R Patil and UP deputy chief minister Keshav Prasad Maurya. The party also announced key appointments for other critical state elections.

Article Title: 'Because BJP lost’: Omar Abdullah slams Centre over J&K, Ladakh statehood, says people being 'punished'
Article Text:
J&K CM Omar Abdullah (PTI file photo)

BJP Office Torched In Leh Amid Ladakh Statehood Agitation, Police Vehicle Burnt

On Ladakh violence

.

Amid violent protests in Ladakh demanding statehood, Jammu and Kashmir chief minister Omar Abdullah on Wednesday said BJP was opposing statehood in J&K.Speaking to the media outside his office, Abdullah said that BJP was the only party opposing the restoration of statehood. "If there is opposition to restoring statehood, it is coming only from the BJP,” he said.The J&K chief minister said there is a growing impression in the Union Territory that the party ruling the center will not restore statehood because it lost last year's assembly elections."Sometimes it looks like people of Jammu and Kashmir will not get statehood because the BJP lost the elections. This is an injustice because nowhere was it said that statehood will be restored only if the BJP wins," he said.Abdullah also said his government, which has been in office for 11 months, faced a major challenge because Jammu and Kashmir is still not a state.The J&K CM further said that the promise made to the people of J&K was not fulfilled. He said, "The way the people were promised and the Supreme Court was informed, we expected it to be a three-step process: first delimitation, then elections, followed by restoration of statehood," the chief minister said."The delimitation happened, elections were conducted and people enthusiastically participated in the polls. It was bad luck for the BJP that they did not win the polls, but people cannot be punished for that," he said.Abdullah later tweeted that Ladakh had been betrayed and was angry. "Ladakh wasn’t even promised Statehood, they celebrated UT status in 2019 & they feel betrayed & angry. Now try to imagine how betrayed & disappointed we in J&K feel when the promise of statehood to J&K remains unfulfilled even though we have gone about demanding it democratically, peacefully & responsibly," he wrote.Parliament passed a resolution in August 2019 declaring the abrogation of the provisions of Article 370 of the constitution, which gave special status to Jammu and Kashmir. It also proposed bifurcation of the state into two Union territories Jammu and Kashmir and Ladakh.Last month, the Supreme Court said the “ground situation” in Jammu and Kashmir must be weighed before restoring its statehood, stressing that “incidents like Pahalgam” cannot be ignored. The top court also sought a response from the centre on a plea demanding the restoration of statehood to the region.
Article Summary: BJP Office Torched In Leh Amid Ladakh Statehood Agitation, Police Vehicle Burnt. Jammu and Kashmir chief minister Omar Abdullah said BJP was opposing statehood in J&K. He said there is a growing impression that the party ruling the center will not restore statehood because it lost last year's assembly elections.

Article Title: Bihar assembly elections: Two more parties join Mahagathbandhan; seat-sharing deal to get complex?
Article Text:
PM Modi’s 'Kosi' Jibe at Opposition Ignites Bihar Election Heat During MP Flats Inauguration

NEW DELHI: The seat-sharing negotiations for upcoming assembly elections in Bihar have become more complex as two new parties - Jharkhand Mukti Morcha (JMM) and Pashupati Paras's LJP faction - joined the Mahagathbandhan alliance. The situation is getting trickier as major parties are firm on their seat demands.The 243 seats will now be divided among eight parties -- Rashtriya Janata Dal, Congress, CPI, CPM, VIP, LJP (Paras) and JMM.“Two more parties are expected to be part of the INDIA bloc soon and we all have to sacrifice our share of seats to accommodate the new partners.” State Congress president Rajesh Kumar told reporters after a discussion during a key meeting of INDIA bloc leaders at the official residence of RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav.Meanwhile, Congress insist that it cannot go below the 70 seats.VIP chief Mukesh Sahani, on the other hand, has demanded “60 seats plus the post of deputy CM” while the CPI-ML is pressing for at least 40 seats, pointing to its past performance.The RJD is also unwilling to contest on fewer than 150 seats.In 2020 assembly elections, Rashtriya Janata Dal had contested on 144 seats, of which it won 75.Congress won 19 out of 70 seats.CPI-ML contested 19 seats and won 12.CPM contested 4 seats and was successful in winning 2 seats.CPI contested on 6 seats and won 2 seats.RJD's Tejashwi Yadav has already declared himself as the CM face of the opposition INDIA bloc.Addressing the rally in Ara town, the last stopover of the 'Voter Adhikar Yatra', Tejashwi questioned the Nitish Kumar government in Bihar for "frequently copying his ideas" and described it as a "copycat government". Ridiculing the government for copying his ideas, he said that at present he was moving ahead while the govt was behind him."Tejashwi aage-aage, Sarkar pichhe-pichhe. Original CM chahiye ki duplicate?" (Tejashwi is moving ahead while the govt is following him from behind. Do you want a duplicate CM or the original CM?), Tejashwi asked the crowd.
Article Summary: Two new parties - Jharkhand Mukti Morcha (JMM) and Pashupati Paras's LJP faction - joined the Mahagathbandhan alliance. The 243 seats will now be divided among eight parties -- Rashtriya Janata Dal, Congress, CPI, CPM, VIP, LJP (Paras) and JMM.

Article Title: 'Chilli powder thrown, beaten, dragged': Woman 'kidnapped' by parents from in-laws' house in Hyderabad
Article Text:
A young woman in Narsampally village, who married against her parents' wishes, was allegedly forcibly taken from her in-laws' home

(With agency inputs)





NEW DELHI: A young woman who married against her parents’ wishes was allegedly forcibly taken from her in-laws’ home in Narsampally village on Wednesday, police said.A video of the incident has gone viral.The couple tied the knot four months ago, but the woman’s parents opposed the marriage, believing the groom did not have a "proper" career.Both families belong to the same caste and are related.According to police, after the couple returned home following their wedding, the woman’s parents and relatives visited her in-laws’ house, which led to an argument.The woman was then reportedly pulled out of the house and dragged into a car. The husband and in-laws claimed that chilli powder was thrown at them and they were beaten during the incident.A kidnap case has been filed against the woman’s parents and four other family members at Keesara police station.The woman later informed police that she is currently with her father and plans to come to the station the next day.
Article Summary: The couple tied the knot four months ago, but the woman’s parents opposed the marriage, believing the groom did not have a "proper" career. Both families belong to the same caste and are related. The husband and in-laws claimed that chilli powder was thrown at them and they were beaten during the incident.

Article Title: Dramatic shift ahead of Bihar polls: Congress takes frontline role in INDI Alliance; seeks to sideline RJD
Article Text:
Representative Image





PATNA: Congress announced on Thursday that it would lead INDIA bloc's Bihar assembly elections campaign and take full responsibility for running the next govt, a dramatic shift that sidelines long-time ally RJD The move comes a day after Congress Working Committee met in Patna. Until now, Lalu Prasad-led RJD had fronted the opposition's poll battle. RJD functionaries declined to comment.Addressing reporters at the party office, AICC general secretary and Rajya Sabha MP Syed Naseer Hussain alleged NDA was preparing for "vote chori" and said Congress would not back down."The next elections are very important for us. Congress will not only lead the opposition poll campaign but will also implement the guarantees in the EBC Justice Resolution and the CMP of our manifesto under the supervision of Mallikarjun Kharge and Rahul Gandhi," Hussain said.Hussain said Congress would focus on putting Bihar on a path of progress by fulfilling its manifesto promises. "We will fight the elections with full responsibility and also run govt in the coming days," he added. This is the first time in more than three decades that Congress has taken front-line interest in Bihar's politics.A senior RJD member downplayed the shift. "During election time, every party tries to boost the morale of its workers. This is just a part of that strategy," he said.Congress has also avoided backing RJD's Tejashwi Yadav as the bloc's CM face. Wh-ile Left and VIP have endorsed him, Congress has sidestepped questions on his role.
Article Summary: Congress announced on Thursday that it would lead INDIA bloc's Bihar assembly elections campaign and take full responsibility for running the next govt. The move comes a day after Congress Working Committee met in Patna. Until now, Lalu Prasad-led RJD had fronted the opposition's poll battle.

Article Title: Madhya Pradesh: Ex-girlfriend run over by speeding scooter after refusing reconciliation; accused booked
Article Text: INDORE: A young man allegedly ran over his ex-girlfriend with a speeding Activa in the Heera Nagar area of the city after she refused to live with him again. The incident took place on Wednesday evening in Kalpana Nagar area, police said.According to Heeranagar police station in-charge Sushil Patel, the accused, identified as Rajendra Chaurasia, stopped the woman on the street and insisted on living together.When she refused, an argument broke out between them. Enraged, Rajendra left the spot but soon returned on an Activa, speeding towards her.The woman tried to defend herself by lifting a stone, but the accused did not stop and hit her with the vehicle before fleeing the scene. Passersby managed to help and lift her to safety.CCTV footage of the incident has emerged, and the victim has filed a complaint at the police station.Rajendra has been booked for molestation and attempted murder.Police said the accused has seven prior criminal cases registered against him, and a manhunt is underway to apprehend him.
Article Summary: A young man allegedly ran over his ex-girlfriend with a speeding Activa. The incident took place in the Heera Nagar area of the city. Rajendra Chaurasia has been booked for molestation and attempted murder. Police said the accused has seven prior criminal cases registered against him.

Article Title: Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah announces memorial for novelist SL Bhyrappa
Article Text: BENGALURU: CM Siddaramaiah Thursday said Karnataka govt will take steps to build a memorial for Kannada novelist and philosopher SL Bhyrappa in Mysuru.When asked about BJP's demand for a memorial for the writer, who passed away Wednesday, he said: "Will do it, not because BJP is saying... Let's build a memorial in Mysuru because it's in that city that he had education, professional and literary life. "Paying respects to Bhyrappa, Siddaramaiah said Bhyrappa should have received Jnanpith, India’s highest literary honour.On their personal rapport despite ideological divide, the CM said, “Literature — or, one’s viewpoint — and friendship are different. It is not necessary that we share the same views. Having different views doesn’t mean I should not be his admirer.”DCM DK Shivakumar said Bhyrappa was known for being forthright in both speech and writing.
Article Summary: Karnataka govt will take steps to build a memorial for Kannada novelist and philosopher SL Bhyrappa in Mysuru. The writer, who passed away Wednesday, was known for being forthright in both speech and writing.
